Sentencas: A transitional layer is introduced between the La0.75Sr0.25Cr0.5Mn0.5O3-delta-Gd0.1Ce0.9O1.95 (LSCM-GDC) cathode and the YSZ (8 mol% Y2O3 stabilized ZrO2) electrolyte by a calcining-stripping-calcining method to improve the cell performance for CO2 electroreduction.
Titulo: CO2 electroreduction enhanced by transitional layer at cathode/electrolyte interface

Sentencas: The effects of second calcination temperature and the LSCM/GDC weight ratio in the transitional layer are investigated to understand the role of the transitional layer.
Titulo: CO2 electroreduction enhanced by transitional layer at cathode/electrolyte interface

Sentencas: Experimental results reveal that the transitional layer is effective to decrease the cathodic polarization resistance.
Titulo: CO2 electroreduction enhanced by transitional layer at cathode/electrolyte interface

Sentencas: The cell performance increases with increasing the second calcination temperature in the temperature range of 800-1200 degrees C, but decreases at a higher second calcination temperature.
Titulo: CO2 electroreduction enhanced by transitional layer at cathode/electrolyte interface

Sentencas: The optimal performance is achieved at the second calcination temperature of 1200 degrees C and the LSCM/GDC weight ratio of 1:1 in the transitional layer.
Titulo: CO2 electroreduction enhanced by transitional layer at cathode/electrolyte interface

Sentencas: The current densities of the optimized cell with a transitional layer are improved by approximately 50% at various applied voltages compared to the cell without the transitional layer.
Titulo: CO2 electroreduction enhanced by transitional layer at cathode/electrolyte interface

Sentencas: Besides, based on the calculation results of distribution of the relaxation time and the experimental results, the performance improvement is related to the enhancement of the diffusion and exchange processes of the oxygen species at the three phase boundaries after the introduction of the transitional layer.
Titulo: CO2 electroreduction enhanced by transitional layer at cathode/electrolyte interface
